comments:
This course focuses on the management and evaluation of physical, emotional, socio-cultural and educational needs of gynecologic primary health care of women from adolescence through post-menopausal years. The content is directed at expanding the expertise of the student in in meeting the primary women's health care needs in contemporary society. Social influences that have an impact on women's lives are also explored.

Several students felt that the course did not utilize class time to the fullest extent or cover topics equally, but nevertheless provided "a wealth of information." Students generally remarked that they felt "prepared" and "very confident" after finishing the course.

The course was taught by Professor Durain and Professor Grube. Many students found the faculty to be "supportive" and enjoyed the guest speakers, but several students remarked that the guest lectures weren't completely relevant to the course objectives.

Reviews for this class were generally positive. Some students found the readings to be occasionally disorganized or irrelevant to the course objectives, but regarded them as overall "very useful." The pre-requisites are NURS 607, 657, and 780.
